item.title: DOJ launches criminal investigation into Fed Chair Jerome Powell, he says
item.description: Federal prosecutors have launched a criminal investigation into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, he confirmed in a statement Sunday night.

item.title: Iran protests continue with 538 people killed, activists say
item.description: At least 538 people have been killed in the anti-government across Iran, according to data published on Sunday by the Human Rights Activists News Agen...

item.title: Nearly 16,000 New York City nurses prepare to strike as contract talks stall
item.description: The largest nurses' strike in New York City history could begin on Monday morning.

item.title: WATCH: Snowboarders carried away by avalanche in Rocky Mountain National Park
item.description: Three snowboarders were caught up in an avalanche in Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado. No serious injuries were reported.

item.title: WATCH: Celebrating automotive history in the motor city
item.description: Jill Woodward, the president and CEO of the Ford Piquette Avenue Plant Museum, dives into the rich automotive history in Detroit, Michigan.
